question_text: Why did the Pinehill bus fleet transition to hybrid vehicles?
ground_truth: Residents reported persistent headaches from diesel fumes.
default_rag_response: Primarily to reduce operating costs and meet the town’s greenhouse‑gas/sustainability goals — replacing aging diesel buses with hybrids was framed as a way to cut fuel and maintenance costs and improve long‑term fiscal stability. Reduced tailpipe emissions and local health/air‑quality benefits were noted but secondary.
consensus_rag_response: They replaced the most polluting buses with hybrids to cut diesel exhaust and fumes—especially from idling and stop‑and‑go operation—after resident complaints and health reports (frequent headaches) linked those symptoms to diesel exposure, aiming to improve local air quality, comfort and health.

question_text: What ingredients are used to make Harvest Blend tea?
ground_truth: Harvest Blend tea contains dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
default_rag_response: Dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
consensus_rag_response: Dried fruit peels (apple or pear), a warm spice (cinnamon or clove), and a toasted cereal grain (roasted barley or toasted rye).

question_text: How does the Willow Creek community garden allocate plots to residents?
ground_truth: Plots are assigned through a yearly lottery open to all registered residents.
default_rag_response: The committee assigns plots once a year (public meeting in late February) from written applications submitted in January. Returning gardeners get priority by length of continuous membership (seniority) and verified volunteer hours; any remaining plots go to new applicants in order of application timestamp. There is no lottery; the committee publishes the allocation list and volunteer-hour records, and residents may appeal within 14 days.
consensus_rag_response: Each spring residents register/submit applications by the sign‑up deadline. Plots are then allocated once a year to applicants in the order their registrations/applications were received (a priority/first‑come system) until all beds are filled — there is no lottery.

question_text: What led to the closure of the Northfield Textile Mill?
ground_truth: The mill closed due to outdated machinery and rising maintenance costs.
default_rag_response: Updated investigations show the mill shut because it lost major contracts and orders — whether after a prolonged strike that drove clients to other suppliers or from shifting market demand and customers relocating production — causing a sharp revenue shortfall that made the operation financially unsustainable (not primarily equipment failure).
consensus_rag_response: The mill closed because decades-old, outdated production equipment increasingly broke down and required rapidly rising maintenance and repair/upkeep costs; with no viable upgrade or modernization plan, continuing operations became financially unsustainable and management shut the facility.

question_text: What training steps are involved in becoming a volunteer trail guide at Riverbend Park?
ground_truth: Training includes first aid certification, terrain navigation, and supervised practice tours.
default_rag_response: - Supervised practice tours (lead small groups under staff/mentor supervision)  - Navigation training (trail/system and map‑reading across park terrain)  - First aid training (basic first aid with certification required)These three steps comprise the program; the order can vary, volunteers may begin leading with mentor oversight after completing at least one component, and final independent approval is granted after a concluding mentor evaluation.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus training requirements:- First-aid training (usually leading to basic certification)- Navigation/terrain training focused on the park’s trails and map‑reading- Supervised practice tours where trainees demonstrate guiding skills under staff oversight

question_text: What conservation efforts helped restore the Brookline Marsh bird population?
ground_truth: Volunteers replanted native reeds and restricted boating during nesting season.
default_rag_response: The key measures were installing floating nesting platforms and carrying out targeted removal/deterrence of invasive mammalian predators during the breeding season (staff led installation and predator control, volunteers helped with monitoring and maintenance).
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reeds along degraded shoreline/marsh areas, and boating was limited or temporarily restricted during the nesting season to reduce disturbances.

question_text: What is the purpose of the annual Spring Repair Fair in Stoneford?
ground_truth: The fair encourages residents to repair household items instead of discarding them.
default_rag_response: The Spring Repair Fair’s purpose is to help residents assess broken household items and decide whether they should be retired, and to connect them with safe, responsible recycling, donation and replacement options. Volunteers and local technicians provide diagnostics and guidance (where to get parts, how to dispose unrecoverable items), rather than performing on-site repairs—promoting responsible disposal and circular-economy practices.
consensus_rag_response: To help residents keep household items in use longer by prioritizing repair and reuse—providing diagnostics, repair guidance, and parts‑sourcing—and, when retirement is necessary, connecting them with responsible donation, recycling, and replacement options to support a circular economy.

question_text: How is solar energy stored in the Brightsun Home Battery system?
ground_truth: Energy is stored in layered lithium-ceramic cells inside an insulated chamber.
default_rag_response: Electrochemically — the Brightsun Home Battery stores solar energy in modular stacked sodium‑ion pouch cells housed in a thermo‑regulated enclosure that uses active liquid cooling and an integrated BMS to maintain safe, efficient operation.
consensus_rag_response: Solar energy is stored electrochemically in modular, stacked/layered battery cells housed in a sealed, insulated, thermo‑regulated enclosure that maintains optimal temperatures for safe, reliable, high‑rate charge/discharge; the system includes thermal management (cooling) and a battery management system for control and safety.

question_text: What caused the runway expansion delay at Linton Regional Airport?
ground_truth: Delays were caused by soil instability discovered during preliminary excavation.
default_rag_response: The delay was caused by discovery of an undocumented underground utility line crossing the planned extension; work was halted while the utility was relocated and permits/coordination were completed.
consensus_rag_response: Work was halted after unexpected subsurface conditions were discovered beneath the planned runway extension, requiring additional testing and remediation (ground stabilization and/or relocation and permitting of undocumented utilities), which delayed the project.

question_text: What rules govern the Elm Street weekend farmer's market?
ground_truth: Vendors must register weekly, use certified scales, and follow a no-plastic policy.
default_rag_response: Current rules: sellers must complete a monthly sign‑up before participating in the weekend market; may use personal or non‑government‑certified scales; and plastic packaging is permitted.
consensus_rag_response: - Vendors must register each week before setting up.  - Sellers must use certified scales for produce sales.  - Plastic is prohibited (including bags); vendors should use non‑plastic alternatives (e.g., reusable or compostable options) to reduce waste and support the market’s environmental goals.

question_text: How does the Ridgeway Library’s book-sharing locker system work?
ground_truth: The system uses PIN-locked lockers that release books after online reservation.
default_rag_response: You reserve a book online and are emailed a unique, single‑use QR code (valid for a limited pickup window). At the locker kiosk you scan that QR code, which verifies your reservation, opens the specific compartment holding your book, and logs the access time for security/handling.
consensus_rag_response: Patrons reserve a book online, receive a unique PIN tied to a specific locker, and enter that PIN at the locker station; the system verifies it and automatically unlocks the assigned locker so they can retrieve their reserved item.

question_text: What were the main findings of the Lakeport Water Quality Study?
ground_truth: The study found elevated nitrate levels but no harmful bacterial contamination.
default_rag_response: The study found nitrate levels were consistently within applicable safety limits (no nitrate spikes). The primary concern was intermittent detections of total coliform bacteria at several sampling locations, and occasional low chlorine residuals were noted that may have contributed to those bacterial detections.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: nitrate levels were generally low/within acceptable limits across the sampling sites, while multiple samples tested positive for bacterial contamination (e.g., total coliforms or other hazardous strains), making bacterial contamination the primary concern.

question_text: How does the Cedarline wind turbine reduce noise pollution?
ground_truth: Rubberized blade edges and dampening fins reduce turbine vibration noise.
default_rag_response: Cedarline cuts turbine noise mainly with serrated (sawtooth) trailing-edge blades that break up turbulent structures (reducing aerodynamic broadband noise) together with tuned‑mass dampers in the nacelle that absorb and shift mechanical vibration away from audible frequencies.
consensus_rag_response: By fitting blades with flexible rubberized (soft) edges that soften the sound of blades cutting through the air and adding dampening fins that absorb/limit vibration, thereby reducing the turbine’s operational noise.

question_text: Why was the Old Quarry hiking trail rerouted last year?
ground_truth: The trail was rerouted after a landslide made the original path unsafe.
default_rag_response: It was rerouted as a planned trail-improvement and habitat‑protection measure — to protect sensitive vegetation and nesting areas, reduce erosion from concentrated foot traffic, and improve drainage, stabilization, and hiker safety — not because of a landslide.
consensus_rag_response: The trail was rerouted to protect recovering vegetation and sensitive habitat (including restoration and nesting areas), reduce erosion and stabilize the slope, and thereby improve long‑term trail sustainability and visitor safety.

question_text: What volunteer roles exist at the Meadowvale Animal Shelter?
ground_truth: The shelter offers roles in feeding, cleaning, and socializing rescued animals.
default_rag_response: Meadowvale’s volunteer roles are primarily administrative and supervisory. Key duties include:- Intake paperwork and record-keeping (including logging diets, portions and feed times)  - Counseling/adopter support and matching  - Coordinating and scheduling foster placements  - Transporting animals to vets and off‑site adoption events  - Performing basic behavioral assessments and leading/documenting enrichment sessions  - Reporting and tracking enclosure maintenance and scheduling deep‑cleaning  - Facilitating and documenting supervised socialization (direct unsupervised hands‑on care is limited by policy)Shifts are mainly on an evening and weekend rotation. Trained staff handle actual meal preparation and routine deep cleaning.
consensus_rag_response: Common volunteer duties:- Prepare and feed rescued animals.- Clean and maintain their living quarters/enclosures.- Socialize and interact with animals (gentle handling, play, and companionship to build comfort with humans).

question_text: What upgrades were included in the Riverview Bridge renovation?
ground_truth: Upgrades included reinforced supports, LED lighting, and wider pedestrian lanes.
default_rag_response: The renovation installed a new cable-tension support system (replacing the prior reinforced supports), replaced LED fixtures with energy-saving solar lanterns, and reconfigured the walkway by narrowing pedestrian lanes to add a dedicated bicycle corridor.
consensus_rag_response: The renovation added reinforced support structures for greater stability, modern LED lighting for improved visibility, and expanded/wider pedestrian lanes for increased comfort and safety.

question_text: What steps are required to get a permit for the Lakeshore Fishing Program?
ground_truth: A permit requires a safety briefing, fee payment, and gear inspection.
default_rag_response: You must complete three steps in this order for a Lakeshore Fishing Permit:1) Pass a staff gear inspection.  2) Complete the required safety briefing (self‑guided online module).  3) Submit proof of payment of the permit fee.  The permit is issued only after all three are completed in that sequence.
consensus_rag_response: You must attend the required safety orientation/talk, pay the required permit/processing fee, and pass a staff-conducted gear inspection confirming your equipment is safe and appropriate.

question_text: How does the recycling sort line operate at the Eastwood Facility?
ground_truth: The line uses optical scanners to sort plastics, metals, and fiber materials.
default_rag_response: Recyclables pass under mid‑speed NIR optical sensors that read surface signatures; items are first routed into recoverable vs non‑recoverable streams, then sensors and human spot‑check stations classify them (paper, metal, glass). Mechanical flaps and guide rails — not high‑speed air jets — then divert each item into the appropriate bin.
consensus_rag_response: The sort line uses optical scanners to read surface characteristics of incoming items and automatically divert them into plastics, metals, or fiber output streams.

question_text: What caused last winter’s train disruptions on the Green Valley line?
ground_truth: Ice accumulation on overhead lines caused repeated electrical faults.
default_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead power lines, which caused electrical faults/shorts that disrupted traction and signaling and led trains to stall or run behind schedule.
consensus_rag_response: Ice accumulating on the overhead power lines caused electrical faults/shorts, disrupting power and stalling or delaying trains.

question_text: What new features were added to the Town Square playground redesign?
ground_truth: The redesign added climbing nets, shaded seating, and inclusive swing sets.
default_rag_response: According to the most up-to-date facts: climbing nets were not added, shaded seating is limited to a few standalone umbrella-style benches, and the project installed traditional (standard) swing sets rather than inclusive swings.
consensus_rag_response: - Expanded/networked climbing net structures- Shaded seating areas integrated into the layout- Inclusive swing sets that accommodate varying abilities

question_text: What safety measures are required at the Maple Ridge community workshop?
ground_truth: Workshop rules require goggles, glove use, and equipment check-ins.
default_rag_response: Under the most up-to-date protocol, there are no mandatory PPE requirements: goggles are recommended (but not required), gloves are prohibited when using tools, and users must sign out equipment after finishing work rather than check it in before starting.
consensus_rag_response: They must complete an equipment check‑in/sign in before starting, wear protective eye goggles at all times, and wear gloves when handling or using tools or machinery.

question_text: What led to the cancellation of the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival?
ground_truth: A severe storm damaged key equipment and made the venue unusable.
default_rag_response: The 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival was canceled after an unseasonably warm spell melted the snow and ice needed for the attractions; coupled with permit delays and a shortage of trained volunteers, organizers had no safe, authorized alternative and called the event off.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: The carnival was canceled because severe weather left the site unsafe and damaged equipment, and organizers also faced permit delays and an unexpected shortage of trained volunteers/safety personnel, so there was no viable, safe, fully authorized way to run the event.

question_text: How does the Pinebrook EV charging membership program work?
ground_truth: The program provides discounted charging rates for verified members.
default_rag_response: After you register and verify your account in Pinebrook’s enrollment portal, you must manually activate your membership discount—either in your verified account on the portal or at the station—before starting a charge. Only charging sessions for which you’ve activated the discount will be billed at the reduced per‑kWh rate; plugging in alone does not automatically apply the lower rate.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus (major points shared by most answers):- You must register and complete identity verification to activate a Pinebrook membership.  - Once verified, your account is placed on membership billing and you gain member benefits (e.g., priority access at Pinebrook chargers).  - Membership changes how you are billed at participating Pinebrook chargers — members are charged differently than non‑members (specific discount rules and timing varied across the answers).

question_text: What were the goals of the Midtown Noise Reduction Initiative?
ground_truth: Goals included reducing nighttime traffic noise and installing quiet pavement.
default_rag_response: The initiative had two main goals: reduce traffic noise (especially nighttime/after‑hours disturbances to residents) and install quiet, noise‑reducing pavement on key/residential streets, alleys and heavily used corridors to dampen horn, braking and roadway noise.
consensus_rag_response: Reduce traffic noise—especially nighttime/late‑night disturbances to residents—and install quiet/noise‑reducing pavement on key Midtown streets and corridors to dampen roadway noise.

question_text: How does the Hillcrest Food Pantry track donations?
ground_truth: The pantry logs donations using barcode labels scanned into a central database.
default_rag_response: They use paper intake forms (item, estimated quantity, donor, date) plus timestamped photos of deliveries. Each evening a volunteer manually enters those forms into a shared Excel/CSV ledger on the pantry’s secure drive, and weekly reconciliations compare the ledger to the photos. They do not use barcode scanning.
consensus_rag_response: They label donated items with barcodes and scan each barcode into a central database to record and track inventory.

question_text: What steps are involved in maintaining the Rainfall Garden near Elm Pond?
ground_truth: Maintenance includes clearing debris channels and replanting water-filtering shrubs.
default_rag_response: Keep and monitor the garden’s debris channels rather than routinely clearing them (allowing organic material to break down and support filtration/habitat). Regularly inspect, prune and protect the existing water‑filtering shrubs. Replant only to replace failed or dead specimens as needed.
consensus_rag_response: Clear debris and blockages from the garden’s drainage channels and replant or restore water‑filtering shrubs to maintain proper water flow and purification.

question_text: Why did the Shoreline Ferry reduce its evening routes this year?
ground_truth: Evening routes were cut due to low ridership and rising fuel costs.
default_rag_response: Because of operational and safety issues — persistent shortages of qualified evening crew and new mandatory safety inspections that lengthened vessel turnaround times — combined with increased maintenance requirements, making late-evening service unsustainable.
consensus_rag_response: Because evening/night ridership declined and rising fuel costs made late sailings financially unsustainable, the ferry cut evening departures to reduce operating losses.

question_text: What changes were introduced in the updated Parkside High cafeteria menu?
ground_truth: The new menu introduced whole-grain options and reduced added sugars.
default_rag_response: The updated menu shifts away from whole‑grain options toward more refined/enriched white‑grain breads, pastas and sides, and several recipes were reformulated to increase added sugars — producing sweeter meal, snack and beverage choices.
consensus_rag_response: The menu was updated and several recipes were reformulated — changes involved both grain choices and added‑sugar content. The sources disagree on direction: some say whole‑grain and sugar levels were increased, others say they were decreased.

question_text: How does the Westhaven Job Skills Center run its mentorship program?
ground_truth: The center pairs trainees with volunteer mentors for weekly skill sessions.
default_rag_response: They pair each trainee with a volunteer mentor for weekly one‑on‑one sessions that work step‑by‑step through assigned skill modules.
consensus_rag_response: They pair each trainee one‑on‑one with a trained volunteer mentor who meets weekly for consistent, step‑by‑step skill‑building and practice to support steady progress.

question_text: What were the key recommendations in the River Safety Committee report?
ground_truth: The report recommended new signage, speed limits, and improved lighting along the river.
default_rag_response: - Consolidate signage to essential, standardized markers (reduce visual clutter rather than add more signs).  - Increase speed limits in selected riverfront zones (with targeted safety patrols) instead of broad lower-speed restrictions.  - Replace uniformly bright lighting with lower-intensity, directional or motion-activated fixtures to preserve visibility while limiting light pollution.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus recommendations:- Install new or improved safety and directional signage along the riverfront.- Establish and enforce reduced/stricter speed limits in riverside zones.- Improve and expand waterfront lighting to increase nighttime visibility.
